name: Softmin
description: Applies the softmin function to an input tensor along a specified dimension. The softmin function computes probabilities where smaller values in the input tensor result in higher probabilities.

inputs.name: Input
inputs.description: The input tensor to which the softmin function is applied.

inputs.name: dim
inputs.description: The dimension along which softmin is computed.

inputs.name: dtype
inputs.description: The desired data type of the output tensor. If not specified, the dtype of the input tensor is used.

outputs.name: Output
outputs.description: A tensor containing the softmin probabilities along the specified dimension. The values will sum to 1 along that dimension.

notes: Softmin is numerically stable because it avoids large exponentials.
It is useful in scenarios where lower input values correspond to higher importance or probability.
